snippet: The Tehran accord represents a larger conflict of visions as critics question the wisdom of negotiating with what they see as an adversary that cannot be trusted.
abstract: News Analysis; debate over Pres Obama's nuclear accord with Iran clarifies deep political divide between those who agree with his faith in diplomacy and those who see deal as unacceptable appeasement of untrustworthy foe; fate of deal, along with other diplomatic initiatives by Obama, will determine if negotiation can again emerge as effective tool in an historical era grown weary of war.
lead_paragraph: The Tehran accord represents a larger conflict of visions as critics question the wisdom of negotiating with what they see as an adversary that cannot be trusted.

headline.print_headline: Accord Pits Obama’s Faith in Diplomacy Against His Critics’ Deep Skepticism
headline.main: Obama’s Iran Deal Pits His Faith in Diplomacy Against Skepticism
